main event: On 22 June 1949, an observer at Fort Bliss, Texas reported seeing 2 to 5 unidentified objects in the sky over a 2-minute period.
interesting points: The observer first saw 4 objects, then 5, later reduced to 3 and finally 2 before they disappeared,The objects were described as silver on the underside with a reddish tinge on top and had a square shape,The altitude of the observation was approximately 1.5 miles and the direction of flight was north,The observer reported no sound or odor from the objects,The objects moved in a rocking motion but appeared to maintain altitude.
witness description: Army officer (Battery Commander) described as reasonably intelligent and reliable.
